Package hippodrome

Class Stable

  • java.lang.Object
    • hippodrome.Stable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StableInterface

    public class Stable
extends java.lang.Object
implements StableInterface
    Place where the horses rest waiting their turn to enter the competition.
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Hugo Fragata, Rui Lopes

      Condition variable for noticing when the pairs Horse/Jockey are not yet created.

      Condition variable for noticing when the races are over.

      Changes the state of the pair Horse/Jockey to At the Stable (ATS).
      void proceedToStable​(int raceNumber)
      Changes the state of the pair Horse/Jockey to At the Stable (ATS) and waits till the current race is, in fact, the current race of the event which is about to start.
      void summonHorsesToPaddock​(int raceNumber)
      Signal given by the Broker to summon all the horses of the raceNumber race, from the Stable to the Paddock.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stable

        public Stable​()
        Creates a Stable.
        This constructor creates a Stable. Plus, an instance of the repository is also given in order to report status changes on the course of its actions.

        public static Stable getInstance​()

      • proceedToStable

        public void proceedToStable​(int raceNumber)
                     throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Changes the state of the pair Horse/Jockey to At the Stable (ATS) and waits till the current race is, in fact, the current race of the event which is about to start.
        Specified by:
        proceedToStable in interface StableInterface
        Parameters:
        raceNumber - the race number which is about to start.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the wait() is interrupted.

      • proceedToStable

        public void proceedToStable​()
                     throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Changes the state of the pair Horse/Jockey to At the Stable (ATS).
        This method is useful to finish the lifecycle of the pairs Horse/Jockey.
        Specified by:
        proceedToStable in interface StableInterface
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • summonHorsesToPaddock

        public void summonHorsesToPaddock​(int raceNumber)
                           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Signal given by the Broker to summon all the horses of the raceNumber race, from the Stable to the Paddock.
        Specified by:
        summonHorsesToPaddock in interface StableInterface
        Parameters:
        raceNumber - number identification of the next race, where the called pairs Horse/Jockey will be competing against each other.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
